full_summary:
**Tender Title**: **Battery Laboratory**

**Reference Number**: PW-22-01005063
**Solicitation Number**: 22-58048
**Publication Date**: August 23, 2022
**Tender Closing Date**: September 20, 2022, at 2:00 PM
**Amendment Date**: September 12, 2022

**Project Overview**:
The National Research Council of Canada (NRC), located at 75 de Mortagne Blvd, Boucherville, QC, requires a project for the construction of a battery testing laboratory. The project involves performing ventilation and electrical/control work for the laboratory located at 75 Boulevard de Mortagne in Boucherville.

**Work Requirements**:
The contract includes the following work requirements:

* Perform security and ventilation work in the battery lab including:
	+ Electrical and control connections
	+ Architectural work for the installation of the fan
	+ Mechanical work for the ventilation piping network

**Important Conditions**:
All bidders are required to:

* Attend a mandatory site visit on September 1st or 2nd, 2022 at 9:00 AM
* Sign the Mandatory Site Visit Attendance Form during the visit
* Provide a valid Workplace Safety and Insurance Board (WSIB) certificate
* Meet the security requirements as defined in the security policy of Canada

**Procurement Details**:
The tender is open to all qualified contractors. The project will be awarded based on an evaluation of the tenders received. The Contracting Authority for this project is Collin Long, and the Departmental Representative is Jean-Philippe Jacob.

**Contact Information**:
For any questions or concerns regarding this project, please contact:

Collin Long
Contracting Authority
National Research Council of Canada
Email: [Collin.Long@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca](mailto:Collin.Long@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca)
Phone: 450 641-5250

**Additional Information**:
The Office of the Procurement Ombudsman (OPO) provides an independent avenue for suppliers to raise complaints regarding the award of contracts under $25,000 for goods and under $100,000 for services. For more information, please visit [www.opo-boa.gc.ca](http://www.opo-boa.gc.ca). you can also contact the OPO by telephone at 1-866-734-5169 or by email at [boa.opo@boa-opo.gc.ca](mailto:boa.opo
